definition[0]: if a ball or other moving object rebounds, it moves quickly back away from something it has just hit
example[0]: His shot on goal rebounded off the post.
definition[1]: if prices, values etc rebound, they increase again after decreasing
example[1]: Share prices rebounded today after last week’s losses.
definition[2]: to catch a basketball after a player has tried but failed to get a point
definition[3]: an act of catching a basketball after a player has tried but failed to get a point
definition[4]: to increase or grow again after decreasing
example[2]: signs that the economy will rebound next year
example[3]: Stock prices rebounded from Wednesday’s steep slide.
